abstract: World Heritage Center and International Union for Conservation of Nature issue report detailing threats to Great Barrier Reef from climate change and human activity, but do not recommend classifying reef as 'in danger'; report criticizes Australian plans to dump dredge soils in waters near reef; recommendations in report will be put to vote at World Heritage Committee.
lead_paragraph: A report cited climate change, water pollution and the impact of coastal development as major threats to the reef, a World Heritage site.

headline.main: Great Barrier Reef Is Not ‘in Danger’ but Needs Care, U.N. Experts Say
headline.print_headline: Barrier Reef Faces Risks, Not ‘Danger,’ Experts Say

snippet: A report cited climate change, water pollution and the impact of coastal development as major threats to the reef, a World Heritage site.
